00002 #
00003 #  Implement the Union operand
00004 #
00005 
00006 package Parser::BOP::union;
00007 use strict;
00008 our @ISA = qw(Parser::BOP);
00009 
00010 #
00011 #  Check that the two operands are Intervals, Unions,
00012 #    or points of length two (which can be promoted).
00013 #
00014 sub _check {
00015   my $self = shift;
00016   return if ($self->checkStrings());
00017   if ($self->{lop}->canBeInUnion && $self->{rop}->canBeInUnion) {
00018     $self->{type} = Value::Type('Union',2,$Value::Type{number});
00019     foreach my $op ('lop','rop') {
00020       if (!$self->{$op}->isSetOfReals) {
00021     if ($self->{$op}->class eq 'Value') {
00022       $self->{$op}{value} =
00023         $self->Package("Interval")->promote($self->context,$self->{$op}{value});
00024     } else  {
00025       $self->{$op} = bless $self->{$op}, 'Parser::List::Interval';
00026     }
00027     $self->{$op}->typeRef->{name} = $self->context->{parens}{interval}{type};
00028       }
00029     }
00030   }
00031   elsif ($self->context->flag("allowBadOperands")) {$self->{type} = Value::Type("Union",2,$Value::Type{number})}
00032   else {$self->Error("Operands of '%s' must be intervals or sets",$self->{bop})}
00033 }
00034 
00035 sub canBeInUnion {(shift)->type eq 'Union'}
00036 
00037 
00038 #
00039 #  Make a union of the two operands.
00040 #
00041 sub _eval {$_[1] + $_[2]}
00042 
00043 #
00044 #  Make a union of intervals or sets.
00045 #
00046 sub perl {
00047   my $self = shift; my $parens = shift; my @union = ();
00048   foreach my $x ($self->makeUnion) {push(@union,$x->perl)}
00049   my $perl = $self->Package("Union").'->new('.join(',',@union).')';
00050   $perl = '('.$perl.')' if $parens;
00051   return $perl;
00052 }
00053 
00054 #
00055 #  Turn a union into a list of the intervals or sets in the union.
00056 #
00057 sub makeUnion {
00058   my $self = shift;
00059   return (
00060     $self->{lop}{def}{isUnion}? $self->{lop}->makeUnion : $self->{lop},
00061     $self->{rop}{def}{isUnion}? $self->{rop}->makeUnion : $self->{rop},
00062   );
00063 }
